title: I do not know a password that Thunderbird will accept. I cannot send emails, but I do receive them. What can I do?
content: I am unable to send emails. I am asked to enter my password and have tried many times. The instructions to enter my password just keeps repeating over and over. I am at a loss as to what to do. Any suggestions?
creator: ernie3smith

title: what should i enter in 'your login' when adding an existing Outlook email a/c to thunderbird
content:
I've provided all of the other data, no problem. But the <Your login> field has only "YOURDOMAIN\yourusername" in it as a format hint. The field carries an Info symbol, but it's greyed out.

There are many possible domains, e.g. microsoft.com, office365.com, outlook.com, each with possible 3LDs, and the domain-name of the organisation that provides my account.

The most obvious (MYORGDOMAIN\Roger.Clarke) gets the error-message: > Authentication failed. Please check the username and password. (I checked, and they're the same as I use for a webmail login there).

Leaving it empty gets this error-message: > Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password. (That about covers the possibilities then ...).
creator: Roger.Clarke

title: Can Thunderbird seamlessly integrate with popular project management platforms to facilitate task management directly from the email interface?
content: While Thunderbird itself doesn't directly integrate with project management platforms out-of-the-box, users can enhance its functionality through add-ons like "Lightning" or "Trello for Thunderbird." These extensions enable integration with popular project management tools like Trello, allowing users to create and manage tasks directly from their email interface. With these add-ons, Thunderbird serves as a central hub for email communication and task management, streamlining workflow and productivity by eliminating the need to switch between multiple applications. While not native, these extensions offer a seamless integration solution for users looking to manage tasks within Thunderbird. Read More
creator: aneesali396

title: Mancato invio messaggi dopo aggiornamento a versione 115.10.1
content: Thunderbird, dopo l'aggiornamento alla versione 115.10.1 non riesco più ad inviare email da uno dei tre indirizzi di posta elettronica configurati sul mio client. Premetto la configurazione: - email1 su fastweb associata al server smtp di fastweb - email2 su fastweb associata al server smtp fastweb - email3 su GMail L'errore si verifica spedendo email dalla email2 con il seguente messaggio: "Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Si è verificato un errore durante l’invio della posta. Il server di posta ha risposto: MAIL FROM:<email2@fastwebnet.it> does not match authenticated user name. Verificare l’indirizzo email nelle impostazioni dell’account e riprovare." Mentre se invio messaggi dagli altri 2 indirizzi tutto funziona regolarmente. Grazie per il supporto
creator: gattofelix49

title: Start on Windows start-up
content:
How come there isn't a setting to start Thunderbird on Windows start-up? Other relevant e-mail apps seem to have such a setting, which is logical, as the e-mail app is something many people want to have on all the time.

Having to google how to manually add apps to Windows start-up folder in 2024 feels silly, and might even be too much to ask for some users who aren't "good with computers".

There's a reason why most relevant apps have such a setting, and that reason applies for Thunderbird aswell, so stop being stubborn and conservative and get it done.
creator: joonas7271

title: Video Conferencing Integration
content:
Will there ever be an option in the calendar to schedule links to video conferencing platforms like zoom or teams or google meet?

Lot's of other 'smart' calendars have this as an option. For example, when I use google calendar on a browser there is a zoom plugin so when I schedule an appointment it automatically generates a meeting invite for the attendees and put the meeting on my zoom app.

I know that this is probably reliant more on the companies [Google, Microsoft, Zoom] to make an extension for this, but it would be great if this could be implemented in the future.
creator: bencohen1105

title: Can't add Yahoo or Gmail accounts
content:
I was forced to change the passwords on two of my accounts, one on yahoo.com and other on gmail.com after which they stopped working in Thunderbird after entering the new passwords. I completely deleted the accounts thinking I could add them again and they'd work.

They both act the same, so I'll just mention Yahoo. I successfully log in on the OAuth2 popup but Thunderbird returns the errors on yellow. I know the logging in is successful because I get a confirmation on my backup email "Your Yahoo account bogdan253 was used to sign in to a new third party application on thunderbird."

Gmail acts the same. Thunderbird is unusable at this moment, I will have to find another app if I can't fix this.
creator: pbbogdanpro
